thread.title: Honor Guard Member Has Unexpected Reaction To President’s Farewell Ceremony
thread.title_full: Honor Guard Member Has Unexpected Reaction To President’s Farewell Ceremony

author: Fred Maxwell
title: Honor Guard Member Has Unexpected Reaction To President’s Farewell Ceremony
text:
Honor Guard Member Has Unexpected Reaction To President’s Farewell Ceremony "Must have had his ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Things were going smoothly for President Obama at his farewell ceremony , right up to the point in which a member of the U.S. Army Honor Guard passed out and fell to the floor, unconscious. 
A photo of the honor guard , who has not been named, was captured by the AFP news agency and posted to its Twitter account. Member of US Army Honor Guard lays on the floor after passing out during a farewell review for President Barack Obama pic.twitter.com/OG4PtCaXyy 
— AFP news agency (@AFP) January 4, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
It was unclear why the guard passed out. 
The president’s farewell ceremony was held at Joint Base Myer-Henderson Hall in Virginia. 
In attendance were Vice President Joe Biden, Defense Secretary Ash Carter, Joint Chiefs Chairman Marine Gen. Joseph Dunford and other top military officials. Advertisement - story continues below 
During his speech, Obama said, “There is no greater privilege and no greater honor than serving as commander in chief of the greatest military in the world.” @AFP OMG. Must have had his knees locked. Gets them every time. Unless……he's as upset as the rest of us. 
— Amazed in Brooklyn (@Brooklynwatch) January 4, 2017 
“I’m the front man, but you are the ones doing the work,” he told the assembled troops. 
The president thanked Carter for his more than 30 years of “outstanding leadership.” Advertisement - story continues below
